  • Method Details

    • encode

      public void encode(String inPath, String outPath, int nTiles, int seekRange, int GOP, int quality)
      Parameters:
      inPath - the unzipped directory that contains all the images
      outPath - the unzipped directory that will contain all the encoded images
      nTiles - the number of tiles given by the user to define the size of the cell
      seekRange - the maximum cell-search distance given by the user
      GOP - an int that defines the number of images in between 2 frames
      quality - an int 1-10 that defines the quality of the process In this method, we save the Base image in the encoded directory, and we iterate ove the rest of the files, We use the GOPcount to determine when to update the base image. Here we call the matchFinder method, where we divide each image into cells (grid).

    • matchFinder

      public BufferedImage matchFinder(BufferedImage baseImg, BufferedImage destImg, int nTiles, int seekRange, int quality, MatchWriter matches)
      Parameters:
      baseImg - the image that depends on the COP count. The image is not modified
      destImg - the image that corresponds to the iteration (next frame)
      nTiles - the number of tiles given by the user to define the size of the cell
      seekRange - the maximum cell-search distance given by the user
      quality - an int 1-10 that defines the quality of the process
      matches - the intance of the class MatchWriter that will allow us to se the information of the encoding process In this method, we create the grid of the image to get the coordinates for each cell, to do the cell matching.

    • cellMatching

      public BufferedImage cellMatching(BufferedImage baseImg, BufferedImage destImg, int Xcoord, int Ycoord, int nTiles, int seekRange, int quality, MatchWriter matches, int cellNum)
      Parameters:
      baseImg - the image that depends on the COP count. The image is not modified
      destImg - the image that corresponds to the iteration (next frame)
      Xcoord - the x coordinate that corresponds to the cell
      Ycoord - the y coordinate that corresponds to the cell
      nTiles - the number of tiles given by the user to define the size of the cell
      seekRange - the maximum cell-search distance given by the user
      quality - an int 1-10 that defines the quality of the process
      matches - the intance of the class MatchWriter that will allow us to se the information of the encoding process
      cellNum - the cell number we are at, used for the MatchFile.txt. In this method, we create the actual cell, using the given coordinates and the getSubimage method. We call the method tessleComparator to get the euclidean distance, and determine whether it is a match or not.

    • tessleComparator

      public boolean tessleComparator(BufferedImage baseTessle, BufferedImage destTessle, int quality)
      Parameters:
      baseTessle - the cell of the base image
      destTessle - the cell of the image we are comparing it to
      quality - an int 1-10 that defines the quality of the process In this method, we get the euclidean distance, to see how similar the dest cell is to the cell in the base image, and determine if it is a match.

    • applyAverage

      public BufferedImage applyAverage(BufferedImage destImg, int xCoord, int yCoord, int nTiles)
      Parameters:
      destImg - the cell of the image
      xCoord - the x coordinate of the cell
      yCoord - the y coordinate of the cell
      nTiles - the number of tiles given by the user to define the size of the cell In this method, we get the average color of the cell and apply this new color to the entire cell.
